proced.title: DMC-S1000DBIKE-AAA-D00-00-00-00AA-952A-T-H31A_005-00_EN-US_1_1 - Learning Plan: Basic Bike Awareness Training

content.paragraph: This document details a learning plan for Basic Bike Awareness Training. It outlines the development and implementation of a program to improve bike maintenance skills for couriers.
content.heading: 1. Learning Objectives
content.paragraph: This learning plan details the development and implementation of a Basic Bike Awareness training program for couriers. The goal is to improve bike maintenance skills, reducing downtime and improving service reliability.
content.heading: 2. Learning Plan Details
2.1. Content Overview

list.item: Problem Statement: Identifying the need for improved bike maintenance skills.
Learning Objectives: Detailed learning goals for the training.
Curriculum: A breakdown of the training modules.
Instructional Methods: The techniques used to deliver the training.
Evaluation Methods: How the effectiveness of the training will be measured.
Implementation Plan: A timeline and resource allocation for the training.

content.heading: 2.2. Problem Statement
content.paragraph: Bike couriers often experience delays due to mechanical issues. This impacts delivery times and customer satisfaction. A lack of basic maintenance skills contributes to these issues. This training aims to address this gap.
content.heading: 2.3. Target Audience

list.item: All bike couriers within the organization.
Assumed skill level: Basic bike operation knowledge.

content.heading: 2.4. Curriculum
content.paragraph: The training program will consist of a computer-based module combined with hands-on practice.
content.heading: 2.5. Instructional Methods

list.item: Computer-Based Training (CBT): Interactive modules with visuals, animations, and knowledge checks.
Hands-on Practice: Practical exercises where couriers apply what they've learned on actual bikes.
Demonstrations: Instructors will demonstrate key procedures.
Q&A Sessions: Opportunities for couriers to ask questions and receive clarification.

content.heading: 2.6. Evaluation Methods
Formative Evaluation:

list.item: Surveys: Collect feedback on the training content and delivery methods.

content.heading: Summative Evaluation:

list.item: Surveys: Assess knowledge gained and confidence in performing maintenance tasks.
Assessment Results: Evaluate performance on hands-on exercises.

content.heading: Performance Metrics (Post-Training):

list.item: Monitor improvement in on-time delivery rates.

content.heading: 2.7. Implementation Plan

list.item: Conduct a pilot training session with a small group of couriers.
Gather feedback and make necessary revisions.
Track performance metrics and gather feedback to continuously improve the training program.

content.heading: 2.8. Technical Requirements (CBT)

list.item: Players/Plug-ins: Adobe Flash Player, Adobe Acrobat Reader.
File Size: Optimized to minimize download times (under 100KB per file where possible).

content.heading: 2.9. Intervention Implementation
content.paragraph: The intervention will be implemented through the creation and delivery of the combined CBT and hands-on training program.
content.heading: 2.10. Performance Evaluation
content.paragraph: The effectiveness of the training will be evaluated using formative surveys, summative surveys, and analysis of performance metrics.
